title: OpenVMS
summary: OpenVMS, often referred to as just VMS,[10] is a multi-user, multiprocessing virtual memory-based operating system designed to support time-sharing, batch processing, transaction processing and workstation applications.[11] It was first announced by Digital Equipment Corporation as VAX/VMS (Virtual Address eXtension/Virtual Memory System[12]) alongside the VAX-11/780 minicomputer in 1977.[13][14][15] OpenVMS has subsequently been ported to run on DEC Alpha systems, the Itanium-based HPE Integrity Servers,[16] and select x86-64 hardware and hypervisors.[17] Since 2014, OpenVMS is developed and supported by a company named VMS Software Inc. (VSI).[18][19]
